00046 template <class T>
00047 class UnaryPlus: public plus<T> {
00048  public:
00049   UnaryPlus(const T& x) {
00050     plusConst = x;
00051   }
00052   T operator()(const T& x) {
00053     return x + plusConst;
00054   }
00055   T plusConst;
00056 };
00057 
00058 template <typename ArgType, typename ResultType = ArgType>
00059   class UnaryMultiplies: public unary_function<ResultType, ResultType> {
00060  public:
00061   UnaryMultiplies(const ArgType& x) {
00062     multConst = x;
00063   }
00064   ResultType operator()(const ResultType& x) {
00065     // the cast to double is to force "operator*(sat_int16,double) to be used.
00066     return (ResultType) (double(x) * double(multConst));
00067   }
00068   ArgType multConst;
00069 };
00070 
00071 template <class T>
00072 class UnaryDivides: public divides<T> {
00073  public:
00074   UnaryDivides(const T& x) {
00075     divConst = x;
00076   }
00077   T operator()(const T& x) {
00078     return x / divConst;
00079   }
00080   T divConst;
00081 };

00083 template <class RAIterator>
00084 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type
00085 max_value(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00086   return *max_element(start, stop);
00087 }
00088 
00089 template <class RAIterator>
00090 void ratio(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00091   UnaryMultiplies<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type> div(1 / *start);
00092   transform(start, stop, start, div);
00093 }

00095 template <class Container>
00096 Container & 
00097 difference(Container & first, Container & second) {
00098   transform(first.begin(), first.end(), second.begin(), first.begin(), minus<typename Container::value_type>());
00099   return first;
00100 }

00102 template <class RAIterator>
00103 class Ratio: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>  {
00104  public:
00105   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type denominator;
00106   Ratio(typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type x): denominator(x) {};
00107   void operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00108     transform(start, stop, start, UnaryMultiplies<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>(1/denominator));
00109   };
00110 };

00112 template <class RAIterator>
00113 class Add: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>  {
00114  public:
00115   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type constant;
00116   Add(typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type x): constant(x) {};
00117   void operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00118     transform(start, stop, start, UnaryPlus<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>(constant));
00119   };
00120 };

00122 template <class RAIterator1, class RAIterator2>
00123 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type
00124 scalar_product(RAIterator1 start1, RAIterator1 stop1, RAIterator2 start2 ) {
00125   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type sum = 0;
00126   for (;start1 < stop1; start1++, start2++) {
00127     sum += *start1 * *start2;
00128   }
00129   return sum;
00130 };

00132 template <class Container1, class Container2>
00133 Container1 insert(Container1 into, Container2 from) {
00134   into.insert(into.end(), from.begin(), from.end());
00135   return into;
00136 }

00154 template <class RAIterator1, class RAIterator2>
00155 class ScalarProduct: public binary_function<RAIterator1, RAIterator1, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type >  {
00156  public:
00157   vector<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type> v2;
00158   ScalarProduct(RAIterator2 start, RAIterator2 stop) :v2(start, stop){};
00159   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type 
00160     operator()(RAIterator1 start, RAIterator2 stop) {
00161     return scalar_product(start, stop, v2.begin());
00162   }
00163 };

00165 template <class T>
00166 class adder : public unary_function<T, void> {
00167 public:
00168   adder() : result(0) {}
00169   T result;
00170   T operator()(T x) { 
00171     T last = result;
00172     result += x; 
00173     assert(((x >= 0 && result >= last) || (x <= 0 && result <= last)) && "Possible overflow in adder<>");
00174     return result;
00175   }
00176 };

00178 template <class T>
00179 T square(T x) {
00180   return x * x;
00181 }
00182 
00183 template <class T>
00184 class square_adder : public unary_function<T, void> {
00185 public:
00186   square_adder() : result(0) {}
00187   T result;
00188   void operator()(T x) { 
00189     T last = result;
00190     result += square(x); 
00191     assert( result >= last && "Possible overflow in square_adder<>");
00192   }
00193 };

00195 template <class T>
00196 class resizer : public unary_function<T, void> {
00197 public:
00198   long size;
00199   resizer(long s) {
00200     size = s;
00201   }
00202   void operator()(T x) { x.resize(size); }
00203 };

00264 template<class OutputIterator>
00265 class NumericSequence {
00266   typedef typename iterator_traits<OutputIterator>::value_type Number;
00267 public:
00268   OutputIterator operator()(Number offset, Number increment, int size, OutputIterator result) {
00269     *result = offset; result ++;
00270     for (; result < result + size; result ++) {
00271       *result = *(result - 1) + increment;
00272     }
00273     return result;
00274   }
00275 };

00280 vector<T> sequence(long size, T start, T inc = 1) {
00281   vector <T> result;

00283     result.insert(start, result.end);

00285   }

00289 
00290 template<class T> 
00291 vector<T> intSequence(long size, T start = 0, T inc = 1, T mod = 0, int rep = 1) {
00292   vector <T> result;
00293   for (long i = 0; i < size/rep; i++) {
00294     for ( int j = 0; j < rep; j++) {
00295       result.push_back(mod == 0 ? start: start % mod);
00296     }
00297     start += inc;
00298   }
00299   return result;
00300 }
00301 
00302 template <class RandomAccessIterator>
00303 string join (RandomAccessIterator start, RandomAccessIterator stop, string sep = "\t") {
00304   if (start < stop) {
00305     ostringstream oneoSstream;
00306     for(; start < stop-1; start++) {
00307       oneoSstream << *start << sep;
00308     }
00309     oneoSstream << *start;
00310     return oneoSstream.str();
00311   }
00312   else return "";
00313 }

00315 template<class T> 
00316 class Print : public unary_function<T, void> {
00317  public:
00318   string sep;
00319   ostream & oneOstream;
00320   Print(ostream & ost = cout) : sep("\t"), oneOstream(ost) {}
00321   Print(string s, ostream & ost=cout): sep(s), oneOstream(ost) {
00322     //    sep = s;
00323     //oneOstream = ost;
00324   }
00325   void operator()(const T & x) { 
00326     oneOstream << x << sep;
00327   }
00328   void operator() (const T & x, ostream & ost) {
00329     ost << x << sep;
00330   }
00331   void operator()(const T & x, const string & filename) {
00332     ofstream ost(filename.c_str());
00333     ost << x;
00334   }
00335 };

00337 template <class RandomAccessIterator>
00338 void shuffle(RandomAccessIterator first, RandomAccessIterator last,
00339              vector < typename iterator_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::difference_type> permutation) {
00340   vector <typename iterator_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::value_type> temp (first, last);
00341   typename vector<typename iterator_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::difference_type>::difference_type i = 0;
00342   for (RandomAccessIterator current = first; current != last; current ++, i++) {
00343     *current = temp[permutation[i]]; 
00344   }
00345 }  
00346 
00347 template <class T>
00348 T RandomizedPartition(T start, T stop) {
00349 typename iterator_traits<T>::value_type pivot = 
00350     * (start + (typename iterator_traits<T>::difference_type)
00351        (((stop - start)-1) * ((rand() + 0.0)/RAND_MAX)));
00352  //--start; // keep this! will be incremented once before use. 
00353  bool first = true; /* the "first" flag is a hack as the microsoft 
00354                                            stl doesn't like decrementing start outside of 
00355                                            range in debug mode (even if not referenced). */
00356  while (true) {
00357     do {
00358       --stop;
00359     } 
00360     while (*stop > pivot);
00361     do {
00362                 if(first) 
00363                         first = false;
00364                 else 
00365                   ++start;
00366     }
00367     while (*start < pivot);
00368     if (start < stop) {
00369       swap (*start, *stop);
00370     }
00371     else {
00372       return stop;
00373     }
00374   }
00375 }
00376 
00377 template <class T>
00378 typename iterator_traits<T>::value_type
00379 RandomizedSelect(T start, T stop, 
00380                  typename iterator_traits<T>::difference_type i) {
00381   /*  vector<typename iterator_traits<T>::value_type> tmp(start,stop);
00382   sort(tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
00383   copy(start, stop, ostream_iterator<double>(cerr, " "));
00384   cerr << "\npos "<< i << " value " << tmp[i] << " size " << stop - start << endl;*/
00385   if (start == stop - 1) {
00386     return *start ;
00387   }
00388   T pivot = RandomizedPartition(start, stop);
00389   //   copy(start, stop, ostream_iterator<double>(cerr, " "));
00390   //   cerr << "\n";
00391   typename iterator_traits<T>::difference_type k = pivot - start;
00392   //  cerr << "i: " << i << " k: " << k << " pivot: " << *pivot << endl;
00393   if (i <= k) {
00394     return RandomizedSelect(start, pivot + 1, i);
00395   }
00396   else {
00397     return RandomizedSelect(pivot + 1, stop, i - k -1);
00398   }
00399 }

00402 template <class T>
00403 T next(T x) {
00404   T tmp(x);
00405   tmp++;
00406   return  tmp;
00407 }
00408 
00409 template <class T>
00410 T prev(T x) {
00411   T tmp(x);
00412   tmp--;
00413   return  tmp;
00414 }

00416 template <class RAit>
00417 class skip_iterator: public RAit {
00418  public:
00419   skip_iterator(RAit it, int skip): RAit(it), n(skip) {} 
00420   skip_iterator<RAit> operator ++() {
00421     *this += n;
00422     return *this;
00423   }
00424   skip_iterator<RAit> operator ++(int) {
00425     skip_iterator<RAit> tmp = *this;
00426     *this += n;
00427     return tmp;
00428   }
00429   skip_iterator<RAit> operator --() {
00430     *this -= n;  
00431     return *this;
00432   }
00433   skip_iterator<RAit> operator --(int) {
00434     skip_iterator<RAit> tmp = *this;
00435     *this -= n;  
00436     return tmp;
00437   }
00438   skip_iterator<RAit> operator + (long jump) {
00439     return (RAit::operator+ (n * jump));
00440   } 
00441   skip_iterator<RAit> operator - (long jump) {
00442     return (*this - n * jump);
00443   } 
00444   long operator - (skip_iterator<RAit> sub) {
00445     return (RAit(*this) - RAit(sub))/n;
00446   }
00447   private :
00448     int n;
00449 };
00450 
00451 template <class RAit>
00452 skip_iterator<RAit> make_skip_iterator(RAit it, int skip) {
00453   return (skip_iterator<RAit>(it,skip));
00454 }

00457 // for_each.  Apply a function to every element of a range.
00458 // this is my binary version. Should be in the STL to start with
00459 template <class _InputIter1, class _InputIter2, class _Function>
00460 _Function for_each(_InputIter1 __first1, _InputIter1 __last1, _InputIter2 __first2, _Function __f) {
00461   for ( ; __first1 != __last1; ++__first1, ++__first2)
00462     __f(*__first1, *__first2);
00463   return __f;
00464 }
